title: Who wants a Keen Awards 2007?
content:

What do you think?

title: Organize
content: Here's a request, then.  You don't have to make anything new--but can we at least wipe out this subforum?  It's 2 years old, now, and has zero relevance.

title: Strategise.
content:
An idea I've been toying with is a central reference to all Keen creations, added to whenever something new is released, with an option to rate each entry. A selection of the highest rated ones, based on the usual category system, at the end of each year or so, receives a Keen award.

This way, there's not much organisation required aside from developing the necessary system.

DOS Classics has the potential for something like this, but for some reason nobody gets around to adding new things there.

title: Re: Strategise.
content:
Partially false, Spleen. In December 2006, one of the fangames downloads section was filled up with spam.

Perhaps people don't bother to put stuff in dosclassics.com because of its apparent abandon by the admin(s).------------------
SM: "I could go and write a page about the Theory of Relativity (or whatever it's called), but, what is the point if I don't know what the Theory of Relativity is?"

title: Re: Strategise.
content:
I haven't really maintained it since getting to college, as I've had other things on my mind. Had it actually gained some popularity, I would've been more motivated to maintain it properly. I really think the best solution to this is to move the PCKF to a phpBB, and have the downloads and articles and ratings systems linked to users in the phpBB, but people seem to be vehemently against this for unknown reasons.

If other people do want to help maintain it, I can add more administrators.[url=http://spatang.com/ck][img]http://spatang.com/ck/bannersm.jpg[/img][/url] [url=http://spatang.com/cosmo][img]http://spatang.com/cosmo/bannersm.jpg[/img][/url] [url=http://spatang.com/nukem][img]http://www.spatang.com/nukem/bannersm.jpg[/img][/url] [img]http://spatang.com/scrobblersig.php[/img]

title: Re: Who wants a Keen Awards 2007?
content:
Alrighty, let's do this. First, some questions.

Will the Keen Awards 2007 cover everything since the 2004 awards? Or will we stick to the past 12 or 18 months, for example?

I'd like to get a relatively complete list of potential candidates, once we've decided on a set of award categories. From there we could establish some criteria by which to filter the list down to four or five entries, enough to fit into a single ezBoard poll.

It'd also be good to get some actual trophies happening. I've got a bit of an idea for this, so I'll see what I can sort out.

title: Re: Who wants a Keen Awards 2007?
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]Will the Keen Awards 2007 cover everything since the 2004 awards? Or will we stick to the past 12 or 18 months, for example?[hr][/quote]
I'd like it to cover everything since 2004. Much has been done these years when considering the whole interval, in contrast to the amount of things done per year, which is low.------------------------------

title: Keen Awards 2007 :: Planning
content:
My idea is a bit... uh... extensive considering the source material, but it can always be changed [obviously].

I was thinking about having the selection process for the nominees selected by a private group of individuals, but I know people will object to that.

Also, in each category, there should be some sort of a special prize, like "Most Psychedelic" in section 1 for KeenRush's A New Dope or "Most Useless" in section 2 for my RKeen.

1. Modding (Episodes 1-3)
1.1 Most Unique
1.2 Best Graphics
1.3 Best Story
1.4 Best Overall 2005
1.5 Best Overall 2006
1.6 Best Overall 2007
1.7 Best Overall (Overall)

2. Modding (Episodes 4-6)
[same categories as above]

3. Fangames
[same categories as above]

4. 3/14
4.1 Best Project 3/14/05
4.2 Best Project 3/14/06
4.3 Best Project 3/14/07
4.4 Best Overall 3/14 Project

5. Miscellaneous
5.1 Best Website
5.2 Most Surprising (out-of-the-blue great thing)
5.3 Most Promising
5.4 PCKF Award (awarded to a prominent PCKF member)

6. Best Overall of Everything <-- I really want this one

Let me know if I forgot anything.

title: Re: Keen Awards 2007 :: Planning
content:
That's a very comprehensive list, Q90, and I'm all for using that as a template. I think it could do with some further Keenishness, and some simplifications, as it seems like a lot of categories to keep track of (just MKO, of course). Then again, lots of categories would be rather interesting.

It might be interesting to do something different to "Best X", even if it's just a different name. For example, with the recent level pack competitions, there were Garging (hardest), Yorping (easiest) and Keenish categories. Hearing the word "Best" over and over during awards ceremonies just irritates me.

For example:

[1-3]
.1 Unique Mod/Fangame
.2 Shiny Graphics
.3 Canon Award (i.e. Keenish Storyline)
.4-6 Keen Mod of the Year YYYY
.7 Drool Award 2005-7 for (Modding, Fangame)

And let's not forget things like fan art and comic strips!

Some other ideas:
Foob Award
For useless, but somehow classy or amusing works
Garg Award
Notoriously difficult prod that's also a great overall piece of work
Off The Map
In the spirit of "Most Psychedelic"

Who's up for seeking out all(ish) the works from the past three years and compiling a list? It's probably a good plan to begin with to gather a couple of us and take a category each.

What qualifies a fan game? Need it be completed? An anticipation award could be offered for incomplete games, so things are a bit more even.

title: Re: Keen Awards 2007 :: Planning
content:
I agree, the categories aren't very "Keenish;" I'm not too good at that. Spleen, if you want to take care of that, go right agead.

Commander Spleen said:[hr]Who's up for seeking out all(ish) the works from the past three years and compiling a list? It's probably a good plan to begin with to gather a couple of us and take a category each.[hr]
Will do; I should have it by tomorrow.

Commander Spleen said:[hr]What qualifies a fan game? Need it be completed? An anticipation award could be offered for incomplete games, so things are a bit more even.[hr]Agreed.-----------------------------------

title: Re: Keen Awards 2004-2006 it is
content:
When your browser requests an image, it sends the URL of the page containing the image in the "Referrer" header. If the Referrer is a 3drealms URL it'll load the picture, otherwise it'll return the "Duke wants you" picture.

If the Referrer header is missing it'll also allow you to load the picture, so if you're using Firefox you can right-click on the "Duke wants you" picture and choose "View image" - you can then press the Reload button which will load the image properly.[url=http://www.shikadi.net/keenwiki/]KeenWiki[/url] | [url=http://www.shikadi.net/moddingwiki/]ModdingWiki[/url]

title: Re: Keen Awards 2004-2006 it is
content:
